channel.title: Destruction & Badger41 - 474 Interface Makers
channel.description:
[center][b]Destruction & Badger41 - 474 Interface Makers[/b][/center]
Well it started off as Badger41 making the 474 skill interface and then releasing the emote tab too with it. I messaged him asking if he would like to work together on remaking most 474 interfaces, and he said sure. So for the past 2 days we've been working on the 474 option interface. We have it 99.99% perfect & I really mean 99.99%. So every 2-5 days there will be a 474 interface release such as option interface, normal magic interface, prayer interface, and much much more. As of right now we are not releasing the option interface because Badger & myself want to make one more interface before making a release to make it more exciting.
Current interface(s) being worked on: [code]474 Normal Magic Tab 474 Prayer Interface[/code]
Current progress on the interface(s) being worked on: [code]474 Normal Magic Tab - All positioning done & first 4 rows of tooltips done. 474 Prayer Interface - All positioning done & first 4 rows of tooltips done.[/code]
Pictures:
474 Skill Interface - [IMG]http://imgur.com/DCSeO.png[/img]
474 Emote Interface - [IMG]http://imgur.com/Wl7cC.png[/img]
474 Option Interface - [IMG]http://imgur.com/Ynlgn.png[/img] [IMG]http://i551.photobucket.com/albums/ii448/badger41badger41/clipwmv0016.gif[/img]
474 Magic Interface - [IMG]http://i551.photobucket.com/albums/ii448/badger41badger41/spellbook-1.gif[/img]
474 Prayer Interface - [IMG]http://imgur.com/daw0O.png[/img] [IMG]http://imgur.com/fFTy3.gif[/img]
Feel free to post suggestions on what interfaces to make.
WE MAKE THEM EXACTLY AS 474 HAS THEM! WE DO NOT MAKE ANY INTERFACES THAT AREN'T 474!
WE NOW HAVE OUR OWN WEBSITE! http://474interfaces.webs.com/ Please note that the website is still under construction.

item.title: Destruction & Badger41 - 474 Interface Makers
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Lin:

No I’m not. The editor is dead and I refuse to work on something I don’t like or support. It was originally programmed for learning purposes and then built into an editor, meaning the code is sloppy and I could have made it a lot better. So if you want a better editor, use Peter’s or program your own. An editor isn’t hard especially since you’re just reversing the loading code, which you already have.

Oh ok… i just dont like using peter’s tool because its not exactly user friendly in some senses. Yours is setup better imo but i guess his has some advantages too.

Read full topic

I’ve been doing very well on the Prayer Interface. Here are 2 pictures showing my progress. I’ve spent about 3-4 hours on this interface so far due to the fact I got 100% correct positioning for each and every single prayer.

daw0O.png771×621

All prayers working fully with prayer glow toggling working.

B1b49.png771×621

I have 100% correct tooltips for the first 3 prayers so far.

Expect the Prayer Interface done in about 2-3 days and the Magic Interface in 3-4 days depending on how much work Badger41 does each day.

item.title: Destruction & Badger41 - 474 Interface Makers
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:13, topic:362041”][quote author=Phaze One link=topic=458316.msg3354794#msg3354794 date=1285707514]
Ever noticed that bluurr clients have about a billion unused sprites in the cache/sprites/“spirts?” that would be the 5-7mb bs.

Currently my client loads a 763kb sprite folder with 176 files for my hardcoded interfaces.

However I may be wrong (as usual) because I do use the suite to cache pack maps and image archives constantly and most of my current regions are 474-508 maps. But my point is to warn people who may be using this of the consequences and if they do not have a backup of their cache that they will have to dump the interface from an unharmed cache.

Also what are the draw backs of hardcoding interfaces? Please elaborate

But all in all well done for helping people (I’m not here to criticize your work)
[/quote]

I wasnt specifically referring to interfaces, i was talking about hard coding in general, If you hard code a method to preload models for example, the draw back is anyone can freely steal your model if it is custom. If you are loading alot of models it will become quite large in size. Stuff like that.

Hard coding/modifying class files needs to have backups as well, although not on such a large scale, if you mess up hard coding something, you are in a pickle as well.[/quote]

Perhaps, but it is simpler to fix hardcoded fuckups. That however is true. I ‘borrowed’ some of apocolyptism 474’s maps which were sitting there in the cache mainly because Harry used an object map editor to fix missing objects. I now have almost perfect 508 edgeville :P. You can always compress models into a single file however and use the ModelDecompressor class to load them.

Read full topic

item.title: Destruction & Badger41 - 474 Interface Makers
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:12, topic:362041”]Ever noticed that bluurr clients have about a billion unused sprites in the cache/sprites/“spirts?” that would be the 5-7mb bs.

Currently my client loads a 763kb sprite folder with 176 files for my hardcoded interfaces.

However I may be wrong (as usual) because I do use the suite to cache pack maps and image archives constantly and most of my current regions are 474-508 maps. But my point is to warn people who may be using this of the consequences and if they do not have a backup of their cache that they will have to dump the interface from an unharmed cache.

Also what are the draw backs of hardcoding interfaces? Please elaborate

But all in all well done for helping people (I’m not here to criticize your work)[/quote]

I wasnt specifically referring to interfaces, i was talking about hard coding in general, If you hard code a method to preload models for example, the draw back is anyone can freely steal your model if it is custom. If you are loading alot of models it will become quite large in size. Stuff like that.

Hard coding/modifying class files needs to have backups as well, although not on such a large scale, if you mess up hard coding something, you are in a pickle as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Destruction & Badger41 - 474 Interface Makers
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:11, topic:362041”][quote author=Phaze One link=topic=458316.msg3354633#msg3354633 date=1285690158]

Hardcode them. This will undoubtedly screw around with your client.

Honestly i must say you are confused, its hard coding that has fucked most of the clients you see today, would you rather import 100+ lines of code into a class file and have a 3mb sprites folder or would you rather place them in the cache where they are incognito and compressed, while all the variables for an interface are neatly stored all in 1 file which you can freely replace with others if you wish.

@OP: whys the scroll box missing from my emote interface? o.O

Bit of an over exaggeration there. Importing 100 lines of code causes no issues client wise and the sprites are usually less than nine hundred bytes each. From experience using the cache suite to pack files ends in disaster after used multiple times. It causes constant crashes, unpacking errors and will change things that were properly hardcoded. Quote from you:

**Do not use these interfaces if you are using the following:
Sir Harry’s 474 options interface
Hardcoded Lunar Interface
New equipment tab

Don’t end up with a client like mine lol.
[/quote]

so far ive made 5+ new image archives in the cache and i havent gotten any issues client sided. All different times.
What files were you packing anyway?

@my quote, i said that because Lin’s editor sets the ids itself and it is not possible to change them. And alot of hard coded interfaces use ids that were generated inside of the editor, and 2 child ids do not mix. In this case the hard coded interface would interfere with the interface.dat.

You say packing things into the cache causes corrupted and errors, yet alot of hard coded stuff has its own consequences and draw backs.

Adding constant 100 lines of codes can increase the size of a file in no time, a 3mb sprites folder is not exactly an exaggeration as ive played servers before that had somewhat of a 5 - 7mb sprites folder.[/quote]

Ever noticed that bluurr clients have about a billion unused sprites in the cache/sprites/“spirts?” that would be the 5-7mb bs.

Currently my client loads a 763kb sprite folder with 176 files for my hardcoded interfaces.

However I may be wrong (as usual) because I do use the suite to cache pack maps and image archives constantly and most of my current regions are 474-508 maps. But my point is to warn people who may be using this of the consequences and if they do not have a backup of their cache that they will have to dump the interface from an unharmed cache.

Also what are the draw backs of hardcoding interfaces? Please elaborate

But all in all well done for helping people (I’m not here to criticize your work)

Read full topic

item.title: Destruction & Badger41 - 474 Interface Makers
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:10, topic:362041”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=458316.msg3353965#msg3353965 date=1285618636]

Hardcode them. This will undoubtedly screw around with your client.

Honestly i must say you are confused, its hard coding that has fucked most of the clients you see today, would you rather import 100+ lines of code into a class file and have a 3mb sprites folder or would you rather place them in the cache where they are incognito and compressed, while all the variables for an interface are neatly stored all in 1 file which you can freely replace with others if you wish.

@OP: whys the scroll box missing from my emote interface? o.O
[/quote]

Bit of an over exaggeration there. Importing 100 lines of code causes no issues client wise and the sprites are usually less than nine hundred bytes each. From experience using the cache suite to pack files ends in disaster after used multiple times. It causes constant crashes, unpacking errors and will change things that were properly hardcoded. Quote from you:

**Do not use these interfaces if you are using the following:
Sir Harry’s 474 options interface
Hardcoded Lunar Interface
New equipment tab

Don’t end up with a client like mine lol.[/quote]

so far ive made 5+ new image archives in the cache and i havent gotten any issues client sided. All different times.
What files were you packing anyway?

@my quote, i said that because Lin’s editor sets the ids itself and it is not possible to change them. And alot of hard coded interfaces use ids that were generated inside of the editor, and 2 child ids do not mix. In this case the hard coded interface would interfere with the interface.dat.

You say packing things into the cache causes corrupted and errors, yet alot of hard coded stuff has its own consequences and draw backs.

Adding constant 100 lines of codes can increase the size of a file in no time, a 3mb sprites folder is not exactly an exaggeration as ive played servers before that had somewhat of a 5 - 7mb sprites folder.

Read full topic
